target.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "transport" or r._field == "private" or r._field == "dport"
    or r._field == "dst" or r._field == "hostname") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false and r.transport == "${l4}" and r.dport == ${port})

targets.query:
import "join"

all = from(bucket: "BT_EX")
      |> range(start: 0)
      |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "length")

startP = all
      |> first()
      |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _value: 0}))
      |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with timeA: r._time}))

stopP = all
      |> last()
      |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _value: 0}))
      |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with timeA: r._time}))

join.inner(left: startP, right: stopP, on: (l, r) => l._value == r._value, as: (l, r) => ({l with timeB: r._time}))  
      |> keep(columns: ["timeA", "timeB"])
      |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with timeA: int(v: uint(v: r.timeA)) / 1000000000}))
      |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with timeB: int(v: uint(v: r.timeB)) / 1000000000}))

panels.title: Click the button below to search and set the full timeline of $label (blue means full timeline is shown)

panels.description: A Heat map which shows the GeoIP of the connected IPs and the relative weight which is based on how many times an IP has been seen in the traffic capture.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}"
    and (r._field == "lat" or r._field == "lon" or r._field == "country"))
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")

panels.title: IPs GeoHeatMap

panels.description: Pie chart shows the numbers and proportion of Geo IPs. This is the outgoing traffic. The total of "Value" may be different from the Incoming vs Outgoing Pie chart below because sometimes it happens that the database ha no data about an IP and that IP is not counted in this pie chart.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r._field == "country" and r.label == "${label}")
  |> group(columns: ["_value"])
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "country"})
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: ""})

panels.title: IPs Geo distribution

panels.description: Shows the power consumption over time. If there are empty spots, it means no data was captured in that moment.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "power" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "load")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: mean)
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "load"})

panels.title: Power consumption (mean) / $period

panels.description: Shows the number of packets sent and received.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "No")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: count)
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "packets"})

panels.title: Number of packets / $period

panels.description: Shows the length of the packets filtered by "Layer 4" and "Port" variables.
panels.title: Packets length for ${l4}:${port}

panels.description: Shows the length of the packets filtered by "Layer 4" and "Port" variables.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}" and (r._field == "transport" or r._field == "length"
    or r._field == "dport"))
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.transport == "${l4}" and r.dport == ${port})
  |> drop(columns: ["dport", "transport"])

panels.title: Packets length for ${l4}:${port}

panels.description: A Pie Chart that shows which are the most IPs present in the traffic capture for the filtered Layer 4 and Port value.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "dst" or r._field == "transport" or r._field == "dport")
    and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.transport == "${l4}" and r.dport == ${port})
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["dst"])
  |> count()
  |> group()

panels.title: Destination IPs for ${l4}:${port}

panels.description: Shows the hostnames with their relative IP and if they have been flagged for the filtered Layer 4 and Port. Count indicates how many times an IP have been seen in the outgoing traffic.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "flagged" or r._field == "private" 
    or r._field == "hostname" or r._field == "dst" or r._field == "transport" or r._field == "dport") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.transport == "${l4}" and r.dport == ${port})
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["flagged", "hostname", "dst"])
  |> count()
  |> group()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "count"})

panels.title: Table of hostnames for ${l4}:${port}

panels.description: Shows on the same timeline the packets and the load.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "No")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: count)
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "packets"})

from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "power" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "load")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: mean)
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "load"})

panels.title: Packets/$period and load(mean)/$period

panels.description: A scatter plots which compare the power and the number of packets sent/received.

targets.query:
nt = from(bucket: "BT_EX")
        |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
        |> filter(fn: (r) => (r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "length"))
        |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: count)
        |> map(fn: (r) => ({_value: float(v: r._value), _time: r._time, _field: "packets"}))

pt = from(bucket: "BT_EX")
        |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
        |> filter(fn: (r) => (r._measurement == "power" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "load"))
        |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: mean)
        |> map(fn: (r) => ({_value: r._value, _time: r._time, _field: "power"}))

union(tables: [nt, pt])
        |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")

panels.title: Scatter plot

panels.description: Shows the number of total bytes sent/received.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "length")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: sum)
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "bytes"})

panels.title: Number of bytes (sum) / $period

panels.description: A bar chart which can be useful to see in which time frame most packets has been sendt and received.
panels.title: Number of packets / $period

panels.description: A Pie Chart that shows which are the most IPs present in the traffic capture. It only considers the outgoing traffic. Otherwise private IPs would flood the chart.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "dst" or r._field == "private") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false)
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["dst"])
  |> count()
  |> group()

panels.title: Destination IPs (private IPs exluded)

panels.description: Similar to the Pie Chart, this Treemap shows the most present IPs in the outgoing traffic. When hovering over a data, it will also shows its hostname and if it has been flagged as adware or malware.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "dst" or r._field == "hostname"
    or r._field == "flagged" or r._field == "private") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false)
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["dst", "hostname", "flagged"])
  |> count()
  |> group()

panels.title: Destination IPs (private IPs exluded)

panels.description: Shows the number of incoming and outgoing traffic.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r._field == "private" and r.label == "${label}")
  |> group(columns: ["_value"])
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "private"})
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: ""})
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with type: if r.private == true then "incoming" else "outgoing"}))
  |> drop(columns: ["private"])
  |> group(columns: ["type"])

panels.title: Incoming vs Outgoing traffic

panels.description: Shows how many hostnames have been flagged as adware or malware. False mean not flagged. It shows also how many distinct hostnames have been contacted.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "flagged" or r._field == "private" 
    or r._field == "hostname") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false)
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["flagged"])
  |> distinct(column: "hostname")
  |> count()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: ""})

panels.title: Number of hostnames flagged as adware or malware

panels.description: Shows the hostnames with their relative IP and if they have been flagged. Count indicates how many times an IP have been seen in the outgoing traffic.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "flagged" or r._field == "private" 
    or r._field == "hostname" or r._field == "dst") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false)
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["flagged", "hostname", "dst"])
  |> count()
  |> group()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "count"})

panels.title: Table of hostnames

panels.description: Shows the TPC flags in the packets. Can be useful to know how many TCP connections have been established, but also TCP retransmit and other useful data.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and r._field == "flags" and r.label == "${label}")
  |> group(columns: ["_value"])
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "flags"})
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: ""})

panels.title: TCP flags

panels.description: Shows the number and proportion of the protocols used at layer 4 (transport). Combines with the port Pie chart it can be useful to know if QUICK was used or other protocols.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "transport" or r._field == "private") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false)
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["transport"])
  |> count()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: ""})

panels.title: Transport protocol  (private IPs exluded)

panels.description: Shows how many times the ports have been used. "No port" means no port was used for that packet, only a few protocols use no port.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "network" and (r._field == "dport" or r._field == "private") and r.label == "${label}")
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.private == false)
  |> set(key: "_value", value: "1")
  |> toInt()
  |> group(columns: ["dport"])
  |> count()
  |> rename(columns: {_value: ""})

panels.title: Destination Ports (private IPs exluded)

panels.description: Shows the total power consumption.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "BT_EX")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "power" and r.label == "${label}" and r._field == "load")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: ${period}, fn: sum)
  |> rename(columns: {_value: "load"})

panels.title: Power consumption (sum) / $period

panels.description: Shows how many time a range of values have been captured
panels.title: Histogram power consumption (mean) / $period

list.definition:
import "influxdata/influxdb/v1"
v1.tagValues(
    bucket: v.bucket,
    tag: "label",
    predicate: (r) => true,
    start: 0
)
list.name: label
list.query:
import "influxdata/influxdb/v1"
v1.tagValues(
    bucket: v.bucket,
    tag: "label",
    predicate: (r) => true,
    start: 0
)

list.description: Select a period of aggregation. Valid values can be found here: https://docs.influxdata.com/flux/v0.x/spec/types/#duration-types
list.label: Period of aggregation
list.name: period

list.description: Layer 4 protocol to use as filter on "Highlight protocol" when enabled
list.label: Layer 4
list.name: l4

list.description: Port to apply as filter to "Highlight protocol" when enabled
list.label: Port
list.name: port
